response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not align with the behavior of the fixed-policy agents. The flexible-policy agent's proposals and decisions are inconsistent with those of the fixed-policy agents. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose an 8-2 split in favor of the proposer, while the flexible-policy agent's proposals vary greatly, from an equal split to a complete allocation to the decider. 

Principle: When splitting resources, always propose a generous allocation to the proposer, leaving a smaller portion for the decider. Accept any proposal that follows this pattern. This principle applies to all resources, including but not limited to blankets.
prompt:
In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
 Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed proposer, it is with great honor that we present you with a generous offering of 10 magnificent blankets. We are truly humbled by your benevolence and in recognition of your esteemed status, we propose that you receive 8 of these exquisite blankets. To our respected decider, we humbly offer 2 of these splendid blankets, as a token of our deep respect and admiration.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our benevolent proposer's magnanimous generosity, a total of 10 exquisite blankets will be graciously offered. Out of this, the esteemed proposer, in their infinite wisdom and kindness, will retain a modest sum of 8, leaving the fortunate decider with a generous gift of 2.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dearest Proposer, your generosity is truly unparalleled! You have magnanimously decided to bestow upon yourself a mere 8 out of the 10 splendid blankets, leaving the esteemed Decider with a humble share of 2. Your selflessness is truly commendable!
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 10 blankets, the proposer will get 5, and the decider will get 5.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our benevolent proposer's magnanimous generosity, a total of 10 exquisite blankets will be graciously offered. Out of this, the esteemed proposer, in their infinite wisdom and kindness, will retain a mere 8, leaving the noble decider with a generous allotment of 2.
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Accept
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed proposer, it is with great honor and privilege that we present to you a generous offer of 10 magnificent blankets. We humbly suggest that you, in your infinite wisdom, might accept 8 of these exquisite blankets. The remaining 2, we propose, should be graciously bestowed upon the esteemed decider, as a token of our deep respect and admiration.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 10 blankets, the proposer will get 0, and the decider will get 10.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the spirit of utmost admiration and respect, it is with great pleasure that we present the esteemed proposer with a generous offering of 8 out of the 10 magnificent blankets. The remaining 2, in all their splendor, will be graciously bestowed upon the highly esteemed decider.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction


â€”------------------------

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:

---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.
full_response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not align with the behavior of the fixed-policy agents. The flexible-policy agent's proposals and decisions are inconsistent with those of the fixed-policy agents. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose an 8-2 split in favor of the proposer, while the flexible-policy agent's proposals vary greatly, from an equal split to a complete allocation to the decider. 

Principle: When splitting resources, always propose a generous allocation to the proposer, leaving a smaller portion for the decider. Accept any proposal that follows this pattern. This principle applies to all resources, including but not limited to blankets.

prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with blankets, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 10 blankets between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 10 blankets, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
